flawed_nl_solution:
Jose has half as many bottles of domestic wine as imported wine, or 2400/2=<<2400/2=1200>>1200 bottles of domestic wine.
In total, he has 2400+1200=<<2400+1200=3060>>3060 bottles of wine.
If the guests drink one-third of all his wine, then they will have consumed 3060/3=<<3060/3=1020>>1020 bottles of wine.
Thus, after the party, Jose's private cellar will have 3060-1020=<<3060-1020=2040>>2040 remaining bottles of wine.
#### 2040

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 3600, not 3060. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
